text: 375 ml bottle. Deep red color with a lot of upfront sweetness and cherry then a bit of heat in finish.

Sample at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017, green session. Clear ruby red pour. Aroma has smoky habanero pepper notes with some sweet fruit syrup in the background. Taste is sweet and fruity with cherries and hot pepper notes that linger for a while.
[5/13/17] Draught at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Green session. Red. Cherry, some chili, sweet, honey, somewhat hot finish.

(B. Nektar Cherry Chipotle Mead) Bottle at Anticarnaval tasting, ABV 14%
Bright red colour on the body, clear, non existent head.
Aroma of red wine, grapes. Taste is sweet, with honey, red wine, red grapes, peppers and a mild burn on the finish.
Medium thin body, low carbonation.
Very tasty.
Mbcc green. Reddish. Red,berries on nose, smooth meadowy. Floral. Med full bodied, sugary. Red curranty berries, light chili burn in finish. Sugary sweet, intense, real nice.
Sampled at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Clear ruby pour with no head. Notes of cherries, chipotle spice, dusty musty room, light mould.
Bottle shared. Pours blood red, still. Aromas of sweet cherries, smoke, sweet honey, herbal notes, light caramel. Taste has a lot of cherries, heaty spice, leathery, dates, barbeque, sweet honey.

duft. kirsebÃ¦r mandelmel. lidt oak rÃ¸dvin
smag. sÃ¸d kirsebÃ¦r fad sÃ¸d stÃ¦rk

Tap. Mbcc, green session. 
Clear cherry color. 
Honey and cherries. 
Hint of Peppers, honey sweetness, mild spicy notes. Long, some burning finish.
Tap at MBCC2017, Copenhagen. Color is clear red with very small white head. Aromas and flavors: Chili, sweetness, berries and honey.
Provsmak pÃ¥ MBCC 2017. RÃ¶d med lite vitt skum. Syrlig doft med aning av kÃ¶rsbÃ¤r. SÃ¶t och sÃ¶t och sÃ¶t.
Sample from bottle. Pours still deep dark red. Tons of cherry juice, light vanilla, almonds, red berries and a smoky spicy finish. Really well made slow sipper!

1 day old growler. Pours deep red amber with no head. Aroma of spice, sweet honey, sweet cherries, smokey umami notes and smoked chili. The taste is sweet with notes of cherry, honey, smoked umami notes and some chili heat at the end. The burn sits in the mouth and on the lips for some time. Pretty interesting and different Mead.
Bottle. Aroma of dark cherry, elderberries, honey, tiny smoke. Dark red colour. Taste is moderate sweet cherry and a nice chili heat. Full body, oily feel and sweet cherry chili heat finish.

From bottle at Dangerously Open Bottleshare. Pours a slight hazy brownish ruby red. Aroma has cherries, lots of smoke, nice subtle honey, leathery honey spice, BBQ-sauce. Taste is again spicy, sweet, smoke, fruity acid, and also this honey spicy. Body is oily, but rather light for the ABV. Would love to marinate ma meat in dis shiz!
Bottle, 14%. Clear deep red with no head. Aroma is cherries, marzipan, almond and honey. Flavour is cherries, honey, sweet, smoked chipotle, chilli, slight chilli burn and sticky.
Sample. Super dark red. Spicy - cinnamon, GlÃ¼hwein. Sweet deep cherry, light spice, vanilla, chili on the back, xmas finish.

Ruby with no head. Aroma is chili, nectar, cherry, red wine, honey, clove, even chocolate maybe. Taste is hot chili, red wine and honey. Not too sweet, very balanced. A bit oily but still nice. Good cake-y stuff. I love it.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2017 (bottle) slightly opalescent deep ruby colour with no head. aroma of fresh cherry juice, green bell peppers and some dill, rather smoky, with some notes of black pepper and tobacco. flavour is cherry pips and grilled mushrooms, again rather smoky, with a touch of brown sugar, chocolate shavings and a rather minerally semi-hot finish. heavy-bodied with no carbonation. very nice!

Bottle, courtesy of DerA. Pours clear dark ruby. Aroma of freshly blooming blossoms, honey, berries. Body is sweet and intense, lightly sour, good chili taste. Spicy and hot on the palate, also lingering on fruit. Very good.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2017 Bottle, many thanks derA! Ruby color with no head. Aroma is cherries, honey, flowery. Taste is cherries, honey, so many flowers, and with a nice chili catch. Full-bodied and viscous. Very nicely balanced!

Pours a see through ruby red. The nose has cherry juicy but is dominated by the chipotle smokiness. I get the same Â’lackÂ’ of ballance in the taste. ItÂ’s not a bad taste but you have to like the smoky peppers and the following tingle/burn. I miss the fat honey sweetness and would have liked it a bit more cherry forward. Not a fan of the heat in here either. Others will love it IÂ’m sure.

Aroma: chipotle, flower honey, cherry flower, tart cherries
Taste: heavy sweet, moderate hot, flower honey, candy, chipotle, cherry flower, some tannin

Bottle @ BenzaiÂ’s Crazy Carnaval 2017, 5-10 cl sample, thanks all for sharing! Slight hazy reddish color, jsut some frothy lacing. Aroma of a sweet red wine, very fruity, touch of almond. Honey sweetness in taste, spicy chipotle bite. Very surprised, as usually I find meads way too straightforward on the honey. This mead opened my view for meads as lovely dessert wines. Absolutely delicious!

van fles @BenzaiÂ’s Anti-carnaval Tasting; 37.5cl. schenkt helder rood zijn kraag.Aroma is hÃ©Ã©rlijk, kersen, honing, wat wijn. Smaken zijn enorm zoet, honing, kersen, wat peper op de achtergrond die later wat scherper doorkomt en blijft ook lang houden in de kersenafdronk. alcoholisch. lekker.

Bottle @ Anti-carnaval Tasting. Clear bright red color, virtually no head. Very nice aroma of cherry and candy sweetness. Flavor is sweet, cherry, some candy sweetness, quite the pepper burn finish. Quite pleasant nonetheless.

Bottle @ anti-carnaval tasting. Ruby colour with no head. Smells honey, sweet, cherry. Tastes sweet, honey, red wine. Peppery feeling in the throat afterwards. Bizarre combination but it works. Full body, soft carbo.
Åšmieszne, gryzie siÄ™ ta pikantnosc ze sÅ‚odyczÄ… miodu i delikatnie kwaskowÄ… wiÅ›niÄ…. Dziwne, ale pasuje mi.
Sampel w Chmielarni na MarszaÅ‚kowskiej. Fajny aromat wiÅ›ni. Smak sÅ‚odki, wisniowo miodowy, wrÄ™cz jak syrop. Pozniej wchodzÄ… papryczki, na wyraÅºnym ale nie przegiÄ™tym poziomie.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Panel #9 Rami Rami is drinking a Cherry Chipotle by B. Nektar Meadery at Chmielarnia MarszaÅ‚kowskaSuper schowane alko, slodkie, miodowe wisnie, papryczki niestety rypia po polknieciu lyczka. Dobre za ostreOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

0,375l bottle at home. dark brown / redish color, basically no head. smells of blue cheese, light red wine notes, hints of honey, some fruit notes, wood. nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, oily mouthfeel. tastes of apples, some honey, lightly sweet, light woody, spices, peppery, some alcohol, chilies, some more fruit notes. finishes dry with a light chili burn and notes of apples, honey and peppery notes. I usually do not do mead, and the ones I know were rather sweet, so this was my first "none-sweat" mead. I like it, but I am not totally convinced, I guess I will stick with beer.

Botlle shared. Pours a bright red/ruby with no head. Aroma is vegetal, chilli & bell peppers, backed with honey and cherry sweetness. Taste is heavy sweet with a slight chilli burn that perfectly blends in. Aftertaste is sweet and fruity, tons of cherry.

Bottle. Ruby mahogny in color. Cherries and honey sweetness in aroma, some mild smoke and some spicy notes too. Sweetish notes in taste at first, some honey and notes of cherries after awhile. Bit of smokey vibes together with some burning notes in the end. A very nice combination actually. Warming, slightly sweet and smoky finish, good one. Dessert stuff, but surprisingly good drinkability on the whole.

Bottled. Pours deep red with virtually no head. Aroma of cherries, al little smoke, some chili and honey notes. Sweet flavor that ends up being dry and slightly tart. Medium bodied, watery texture and flat carbonation. A nice Mead. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Wowzers! Very complex and beautifully balanced, this sweet mead has just enough juicy tartness from the cherry juice and subdued smoke to maintain structure. Very little capsaicin spice is imparted by the chipotle peppers, and thatÂ’s coming from a dude who abstains from very spicy foods to maintain in integrity of my palate, as I need it for work. The texture velvety without becoming slick and syrupy due balancing acidity. Not too expensive compared to other meads of similar quality, so pick some of this up!

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Dark coppery ruby red body, no head. Nose is cherries, marzipan, chili, cinnamon, honey and hints of vanilla. Taste is tart cherries, chili burn, smoke and hints of dark berries and cellar mold. Too much chili in this one, but still a nice enough mead.
Rich opened this... Thanks buddy.. Clear like cherry juice... Bunches of cherry flavor, chipotle adds a complex smokiness and a warming spiciness as the bottle drops.

07.10.2016, 0,375l bottle (2012 vintage or older) @ BBGTC vintage mead tasting:
No head, deep reddish color. Aroma is rich and sweet fruity, dry cherries, oak, minerals, cherry stones, hay, bark. Taste is rich and fresh fruity, sweet cherries, grass, raisins, cherry stones, mild grassy chillies, minerals. Medium bitterness, rich fruit mouthfeel, nice warming chili touch. Very nice.
UPDATED: OCT 7, 2016 Bottle. Coppery, burgundy body. Cherry and chipotle on the nose. Flavor is cherry juice and chili-burn. Pretty straight forward, but it works. Very nice actually.
Very sweet, but matched with a nice cherry burst and lingering smoky, pepper burn on the finish. I would recommend as a nice dessert pairing during the fall/winter.

375ml bottle. Pours red in colour with no head. Aroma of dark cherries & spice. Taste is sweet, honey, with berry, cherry, red wine, and smokey notes, followed by chilli heat. Slick moutheel, medium bodied, low carbonation, lingering hot chilli finish. Nicely sippable.
Holy crap this is good. Pours the color of pinot noir. Taste is sweet wine, smoky peppers, chocolate, cherry cordial, and earth. Medium high spice level. So good.
Chipotle pepper smell. Cherry chipotle taste that is only slightly better than the smell due to the fruit. Mild smokey heat with a medium body.

Deep crimson red color. Aroma is sweet and smokey with a punch of spice. Taste starts off with sweet honey and slightly tart cherries. Nice smokey chipotle flavor comes on at end and loingers a bit in after taste. Nice array of flavors in this mead. Enjoyable experience. Would drink again.

Dark red colour. No head. Honey, cherries and spices in the aroma. Sweetness, cherries, chilli or chipottle in the end. Spiceness also in the aftertaste. Sweetness, hints of sourness and spiceness are well balanced. Low carbonated, sweet, rather medium bodied drink which should be enjoyed in small quantities.

Bottle shared at the Canary wharf tasting 16/02/2016. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. Red, cherry blood coloured pour with no head. Aroma is big grape, alcohol, grape, plum, spices. Flavour is composed of sweet and spicy, grape, red wine, mellow spicy, slightly jammy. Sweet. Palate is medium sweet, little fruit, tannin, rounded. Nice depth of flavour. Warming CHILLIE. Honey.
Bottle. Pours red without head. Aroma is cherry, sour, chipotle. Flavor is sweet and sour, cherries. Finish is chili burn. Overall: very nice.

Vibrant blue bottle shared on the 42nd floor. As Â’B. Nektar Cherry Chipotle MeadÂ’, 14%. Very dark reddy pour, with no head. Aroma is strawberry, red wine, honey, dark cherry. Body is smooth, oily, low carbonation. Taste is sweet with cherry, blackberry, port, red wine and then moves towards the smokey chili heat. Well judged stuff. Pretty tasty. ItÂ’s very sweet but that is offset by the chili warmth. But itÂ’s still too sweet to drink a bottle by yourself in one evening.

Shared with JLindros

Poured into a Kate the Great tulip a nice ruby crimson hue with big aromas of cherries and smoky chipotle. Really nice cherries. Taste is similar to the nose, great cherry notes, not overly sweet with good light tartness. The chipotle is nicely smokey with good pepper notes. Really tasty cherry pie filling. That light tartness is excellent too. Really well done.

bottle shared at the Level 42 tasting, London. Thanks to Daniel. It pours a dark clean ruby color with no headS aroma is very sweet an lightly boozy with notes of cherry pie, cinnamon, nutmeg, cherry jam. Taste is also sweet boozy with more strawberry jam and hot warm booze. Quite the flame inside. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, really intense

Bottle shared in London on the 42nd floor - many thanks to Daniel. Pours clear matte purple with a light foamy head. The nose is quite reminiscent of red wine, with some juicy berries and touches smokey chipotle. Medium sweet flavor, with a crazy mix of characteristics: lots of juicy cherry and raspberry, smokey and lightly spicy pepper, sugary and lightly gooey honey. Medium to full bodied, chewy. Warming finish with spicy pepper heat, more sweet honey, lightly tart berries, further vinous qualities. This mead has a dynamic mix of flavors, and it pretty much works. Really fun to drink.

Thanks for allmyvinyl for the taster.
Appearance - deep ruby with a gentle fizz. 
Nose - light smoke, the dried type with a load of fresh cherry fruit to follow it through.
Taste - more of the same. Initial smoke dried peppers then fresh cherry vessels through to quell it. 
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy and sweet middle section. A nice balanced and perfectly tapered finish. 
Overall - itÂ’s a beautiful beer / mead bit IÂ’m used to drinking rich red wines. So I like it a lot but for me it doesnÂ’t blow away a lot of big red wines and ports.

Bottle round mine brought by James. Pours kind of cherry cordial looking; somewhat gloopy/viscious. Aromas of sherry/port fruity something or other that I canÂ’t quite place. Nice though! More carbonation than the visual might suggest, nice. Hot chilli kick upfront, though not overwhelming. Delicious rich fruitiness, in perfect balance to the over all experience. Rich, sweet, fruits, chilli and slight smokiness all in perfect harmony. Lovely shared. Fantastic.

Bottle shared on Xmas Day. It pours clear deep ruby red. The nose is tangy, juicy, cherry jam, Bakewell tart, chilli jam, smoked paprika and sour candy The taste is sweet - sour, juicy cherry, warming chilli spice, chilli jam, cherry wine, tangy fruits, fruit cake, glace cherry, honey cake and marzipan with a warming, spiced finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. The balance is pretty well-judged. Not sure if I could much of this, but it?s good fun.

Bottle; Pour is garnet, with golden highlights. It sheets quite nicely on this glass. The nose is alcohol, char, spiced pepper, and honey sweet. The flavor profile reveals something quite nice, really - ItÂ’s sweet initial - honey, sweet bread - with a nice depth to it - moving to florals, cherry pits, and finally: the chipotle spice near the finish - it creates a touch of a burning sensation in the throat - a terrific and unique experience, we thought.
Drank out of a pint glass, thank you Bjorn! Smells super sweet and like cherries. Has a nice cherry sweet, has a nice kick from the chipotle.

Pours translucent mahogany, not much head but his is a mead. Aroma presents honey and sour cherry. Flavor is mainly sourish cherry with honey and subtle smoky tones in supporting roles. Mouthfeel is fairly firm. Get the buzz.

Bottle at home with the Wife. Pour is a beautiful purple-magenta with good legs. Sweet fruit skins, light smoke, roasted peppers, grapes, sweet honey, and tangy aroma. Taste is sweet cherries, tangy, raspberries, smoky, toasted peppers, a touch of spice, and wax with a sweet and smoky finish. Slick mouthfeel with no carbonation. Really tasty stuff.

Ruby red clear. Intense cherry fruit nose, also some blackberry and pomegranate, some smoke. Sweet with a slightly dry finish and a bit of heat on the back of the tongue. Deep fruit flavors that lingers and the heat builds slowly. Very nice.

Aroma: cherries, smoke, honey
Appearance: clear ruby red
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly sour, mild chipotle heat
Palate: light body, sticky, no carbonation, long finish, 

Very nice

Pour out of bottle, clear dark red pour with no head, still pour. Aroma brought notes of big cherry, honey, spice into a bit of heat, pepper. Taste was a mix of cherry, berry, heat, some pepper notes into some nice honey, finishing fairly sweet, slightly spicy. Somehow this works very well.
Pours a cherry brown. Aroma is cherry compote MEGA. taste is sweet cherries, slight heat and a lot cinammon. Lovely shizniz.
Bottle at home. Clear deep red body with no head. Sweet honey, chilies, tart cherries. Long warming aftertaste. Different, but quite good.
Pours a deep, murky red. Aroma of cherries, honey, and spice. Taste is cherry up front, honey through the middle, and a lingering, spicy finish.

Rated on 9-14-2013 at Fort Wayne, IN Ratebeer gathering (Corked bottle). The aroma is some honey, sweet, peppery and spicy. The flavor is sweet, spicy, peppers, light honey, and cherry. This mead is medium bodied. A sipping mead for sure! A different taste for a mead that I enjoyed. It is worth trying and a mead I would drink again.

Great stuff. Commercial meads are fun to rate for me because I love comparing them to the meads I make. IÂ’m pretty meticulous about my mead-making so I tend to judge off the shelf variants with that in mind. This one has the looks and aroma...with the aroma really coming around as the glass warms. The flavor is very nice but the cherry is a bit more muted than IÂ’d like. Still I love the warming pepperiness that comes on as you finish the glass. IÂ’d definitely buy this again!

Brought this one to foofaaÂ’s going away party, gonna miss ya buddy. Pours ruby red with a half finger tall white head, quickly dissipating to nothing at all. Smells great with lots of chipotle spice and cherry juice. Taste is along the same lines with the cherry and honey sweetness up front with the chipotle heat showing itself at the end of each sip. Overall this was much better than I expected. Lots of flavor and still pretty easy drinking.

WillRunForBeer supplied the 500mL bottle -many thanks! To tumbler, it pours a crimson tomato red. Aromas of pureÃ¨d dark cherries, molasses, cherry tomatoes, Concord grapes, pottery clay, pumpkin pie spices, and cough suppressant chewables. Chili peppers not detected on the nose. Tastes the same with the addition of clover honey, chipotle pepper heat, rye bread, and caramel. It had some heat by mid-palate, but that wasnÂ’t anything: by swallow, the pepper heat is fully in command. I hope my stomach can forgive me by tomorrow.

Sampled from a 375 ml at Willrunforbeer grand mead tasting. Deep ruby color. Aroma has that pepper just busting out all over. Mild cherry.
Flavor is as advertised... Weak cherry upfront with a pretty decent kick of chipotle peppers. Light pepper burn depending on your tolerance for heat. Maybe I would feel different if I paired this with a sweet, chocolate dessert.
375ml bottle. Pours a beautiful ruby red. Aroma is honey, floral, tart cherry. Flavor starts with sweet honey, tart cherry then hits with chipotle spice. Neat.
Poured from bottle nice ruby red color with no head. Aromas of cherry and spice. Taste is sweet with thick mouth feel and strong, smooth peppery kick.
This bottle has been in my fridge forever. Thanks Brad! Ruby red with no head. Honey and red wine with notes of black pepper. Delicious with spice character emerging mid to late palate. Very tasty.

Corked 375 ml bottle purchased at Holiday Wine Cellar 14 months ago ($13.49). Pours a dark burgundy hue with no head at all. AROMA of tart cherries, notable smoked peppers, spicy red wine, honey vinaigrette, and a bit of sour funk (lactic?). Nice FLAVOR of both sweet-ish and sour cherries, major chipotle pepper (adds nice touches of smoke and tang with only low to moderate heat), honey, spicy red wine (Malbec?), and some sticky jam-like fruits. Thick mouthfeel with some lingering smoky peppery spice and heat. Sweet, but the smoke and spice takes the edge off nicely. The high ABV is impressively completely hidden here. This works surprisingly well. Certainly the best pepper-y alcoholic beverage I have had (perhaps peppers seem to work better in mead than in beer?). Wow, I am quite impressed with the execution on this one. (135, 933)
Bottle from MI. Poured clear dark red no head. Sweet aroma tart cherry spice. Min carb med bod. Tastes sweet with a balanced chipotle. Good stuff

Acquired in a $4$ trade. Enjoyed at 45F in stemware. 2 ounce pour. Color is pretty much blood red, no sediment, oily thick. The nose is very easy. Tart cherry with a lot of juiciness and a spicy habanero chipotle kick. Cherry sweet/tart up front in the taste, sweet finish. Middle and finish are incredibly spicy. spice lingers in the throat for a while. too spicy for me but I do like the cherry.

Oak, vinegar, marzipan, cookie dough, cherries aroma. Hazy maroon. Honey and cherry flavor. Jammy and kind of grapey. Chili pepper burn at midpalate that lingers and takes on a more smoky pepper character. Medium body, viscous, chewy and tangy. Exquisite and wonderful, not perfect, but really quite good.

Bottle. Pours clear burgundy, no head, no lacing. Aroma is hella cherry, true Michigan cherries - and I grew up on Michigan cherries, so I know them when I smell them. Faint whiff of peppers as well. Flavor is quite sweet, tons of real cherry flavor, just a bit of smoky chipotle heat, as well as the base honey. Noticeable spice level, but not at all unpleasant. Really well put together actually. Medium body, no carbonation. A bit of lingering heat cuts through the sweetness and makes this a really enjoyable sipper.

Deep ruby red clear no head or carbonation. Spicy pepper aroma followed by sweet cherry pie with caramel notes. Starts as a mixture of light smokey pepper and sweet cherry pie. Finishes with strong spicy pepper flavor that lingers on the palate for a long time. Surprisingly well balanced for such a unique style.

Aroma: Cherry Juice, Mild Red Plum, Mild Hot Pepper

Appearance: Dark Reddish/Mild Brown Hue, Passes Mild Light, No Head, No Lacing

Taste: Cherry Juice, Hot Pepper Heat, Mild Cranberry

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mild Heat
Mead with pink colour. Smooth with honey. Slight heat in finish. Particularly after peppers.

Quite good. The mead is burgundy and still. Appears somewhat viscous. The aroma is chile, cherries and honey. ItÂ’s sweet with a mild zing. The cherries really come out as it warms. Both in taste and aroma, the chile is spicier when cold, too much on the , but the cherry blooms and overpowers the spice as it warms. The mead is quite sweet. It might be a bit much, but spice reigns it in. At room temperature, the heat is warming and prickly. The burn builds in the finish. Moderately tart cherry flavor. The honey flavor gets a bit overshadowed but it seems quite pleasant. Perhaps, with more experience with meads, I could pick out flavors better. IÂ’m just getting a mildly fruity, floral honey sweetness. Fairly thick body. Nice.

Poured from a bottle into a small snifter redish brown with minimal head.
Aroma is cherry sweetness.
Flavor is sweet slight bitter cherry with a definite fire that nicely slides down the throat.
What a great mead. B Nektar does this so better than so many others. Paired with Havarti cheese--excellent!

Pour is opaque ruby red with no head. Aroma of sweet cherry juice, honey, hibiscus, and slight pepper. Flavor is spicy and boozy and first but transitions into a overripe cherry and honey finish. Chipotle peppers are left in the aftertaste. Great.

Bottle->cordial glass. Red with thin rim of bubbles, like cherry juice. A: cherries, hint of spice. T: smooth cherries with definite pepper spice, though blended very well and not overwhelming at all. Spice cuts the sweetness very well. Fantastic coating and aftertaste. Really really good.

Pours clear ruby. Still.
Aroma of cherry and honey.
The flavor is sweet with a nice burn from the chipotle in the finish.
Tasty and interesting mead.

375 ml bottle poured into a tulip. Pours a dark ruby color with no head. Aromas of cherries, hot peppers. Tastes of cherries, sweet apples, pepper skin, spices, booze. Medium-light body with a dry and warm peppery finish. Low carbonation, syrupy mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2015 Bottle at Craig?s. Pours dark red, sweet, loads of fruity cherry, huge earthy spice finish.

Bottle at craigÂ’s.   smells like bakewell tart, cherry and marzipan, taste is tart cherry,honey, light chili, light burn.

375ml bottle. Labeled 12.5%. Beautiful clear dark red color, light red/black color. Nice wildflower honey in the nose. Just a hint of cherry in the smell. Flavor is like cherry juice, cherry syrup, and a good bigger peppery chipotle kick in the end. Bigger sweet taste, kind of sugary and syrupy. Great bigger kick in the finish though saves this. Medium to bigger body. No carbonation, pretty much. Slick sticky texture. Very interesting, pretty tasty stuff to sip on slowly.

Ruby red pour, no carbonation. Aromas of honey and cherries. Flavor is sweet honey and cherries upfront with some wonderful chipotle notes as soon as it leaves your mouth, Finish is just slightly spicy/warming from the peppers. Abv is completely hidden. Absolutely fantastic.

The aroma is sweet, cherries, hint of honey. Pours a clear light red. The taste is a light sweetness. The body is light, the texture thin, the carbonation soft and the finish long. Overall the best Mead I had until I went to Schramms.

Bottle from a free beer week win from umich03jm, thanks again for the beers. Pours a thick ruby red color with no head. Aromas of cherry and spice. Taste is light tart with cherry notes a bit of a cake feel to this with a firey burn at the end. Mouthfeel is silky and lingers for a while. A sipping brew for sure.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2015 Muddy wine red, no head. Rich odd sweetness on the nose, wholesome yet spicy syruppy. ItÂ’s very difficult to form a rate of such an incredible depth to this beer. Salty, almost moreish on a hot dog meatiness. Sweetest burn, every drop being an earnest vibe of rich crafted dessert/madeira/fluffy linger. After such a frontal burn for it to fall out into so many layers of sweetness. Brilliant. Bottle, Cheers Craig, April Not So Fools Tasting
Second Garvie and Stella honour bottle from the same haul, opened latter but now...
Nose is cinnamon sweet, nutty fireplace burnt carpet and singed sweetness. IÂ’m upping the aroma by from this action. Still quite spicy. Spiciness is still there, more in abundance. Spicy, sultry thick honey. Finishes so lean, but still so rich windy spice. Building sweetness.

bottle at Ft Wayne tasting, Sept 2013 - Pours very red with an aroma of honey and peppers. It tastes sweet and definitely spicy. As expected thereÂ’s some good cherry flavor too. The body is medium and the palate a little syrupy. The finish is sweet and peppery. ItÂ’s a good mead. Ideally IÂ’d want the sweetness toned down a bit but I liked this much more than I thought I would a spicy mead.

Bottle split with a couple coworkers. Pours a clean deep red. Aroma of berries, cherry Skol, smoke, pepper, honey. Oily mouthfeel, sweet with a lot of heat up front. Pepper, cherry, honey with a finish of cherry, smoke and red hots.

375 ml bottle, thanks to jtclockwork. Pours deep ruby, clear and still. Aroma: sweet and floral, cherry and something that reminds me of being musty. Alcohol as well. On the tongue: Sweet, syrupy cherry at the outset, followed by a slow smoldering chili heat -- smoky peppers at the end that draw it to a finish, cutting off what would otherwise be cloyingly sweet. Overall: It would be hard to drink a lot of this, but the chipotle contribution to this is really cool -- one of the best integrations of chili I think IÂ’ve encountered in a beverage.

375 ml bottle- Pours what seems to be hazy cherry red. The aroma is cherry juice, more of a peppercorn aroma over chipotle peppers, a little wood. The taste is cherry, cinnamon, weird, the chipotle heat follows, this is unique and very tasty. The spice builds as you drink accumulating to a medium heat burn, very enjoyable. The honey adds a nice velvety texture to the palate. The best of the B. Nectar mead I have had so far.

375 ml blue bottle. Pours still with a ruby red hue. Aroma is cherries, honey, sweaty nasty-ass socks...then the smoke comes through. Weird. Kind of a cigar ash type smell. Taste is sweet, tart, and smoky, like a honey and cherry-flavored cigar; chili heat is fairly strong, but itÂ’s not burning my face off or anything (IÂ’m looking at you, Crime and Punishment). ThereÂ’s some carbonation here, but itÂ’s really light. This is pretty awesome.

Bottle, shared on Valentines day with the valentine. Poured a flat, dark cherry red color. Aroma was lots of dark cherry notes, with a touch of chipotle sauce in there. Flavor started with a lot of sweet cherry notes - like cherry pie filling but quickly segued into a roasted chipotle, mole-like flavor. A touch of burn on the end, but is quite pleasant. I ended up drinking most of the bottle. Very unique. I figured this would never work, but the ratings convinced me to buy it regardless.

A few (three, I believe) bottles in the last few months. Damn, I love this mead. Wish we had more on the shelves at the beer store I work at cuz I would snatch them up. B. Nektar and Ken Schramm make the best mead in the country these days, at least in my opinion. But I have not tried many Kuhnenn meads, regrettably. This stuff is potent with a mild tartness, lots of cherry juice, and a good does of heat with an ever so balanced smokiness. Tons of flavor without being cloying or overly sweet or spicy. Fantastic stuff, here. I am sure it WOULD be awesome with a rich chocolate cake. Hot damn, I get excited just thinking about drinking this elixir.

375 ml bottle shared by a kind soul at RBWG in the Aloft Thursday Night Beer Fart Dungeon. Pours a deep, rich red color with no head. Honey, chipotle pepper, and plenty of cherry - such a nice balance of sweet and spicy here. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation. Palate fatigue was an issue when I tried it so I want to try it again because I have a feeling it may be even better than originally rated.
Pours a deep red colour. amazing nose, so fruity, big cherry, light smoke. Just the most wonderful taste, fantastic.

Bottle during RBWG, thanks! Pours a clear deep amber orange with a thin near white head that dissipates completely. Aroma has a nice combination of spice, honey and cherry. Flavor has a nice chipotle note that is backed by sweet honey and a touch of cherry.
So good. Sweet and slightly tart cherry on the front end with subtle chipotle heat on the back end that lingers ever slightly (welcoming). Great for a cold winter night!
A revelation. I usually hate meads, but this one blew me away. Clear red and gloopy in the glass. Big cherry nose with light spices. Taste is smokey and cherry and intense. Wow.
Bottle. Dark red. Aroma has lots of cherry and slightly smokey. Taste is incredible, so intense, cherry amd honey. Sweet and spicy. Amazing

3750ml bottle pours out nice ruby. Nose is cherries chillies and sweetness. Taste is as the nose a little sweetness bitter cherries spice chillies. This ke pretty fun to try but not that good. Unique for sure.

Bottle, shared at the Boxing Day tasting at TimEÂ’s place in Calgary. This came out last, and in my opinion it was the most interesting and surprising brew of the night. Gorgeous deep garnet red. Intense dark cherrry character in a velvety smooth sticky body, notes of ripe apple and chocolate too. But it is the smokey chilli character that really adds a ton of fun to this excellent dessert wine. Such a crazy concept that comes together magnificently. the chipotle is very dominent, but this mead is so rich and intense that it remains in balance. The heat stays long in the throat-- I was still savouring it for more than half the car ride home. Outstanding! Trade from Sammy-- with great thanks.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Deep burgundy color. Tons of chipotle, cherry and chocolate. Delicate, spicy mouth, flat no carbonation. Spicy as shit, really interesting and tons of Cherries and chillies in the finish. Over the top but wonderful.
Bottle - Cherry and chipotle . Clear red with no head. Sweet cherry heat. Such a small review such a big mead. Awesome.
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2013 Awesome aroma. Red liquid. Taste of black cherry liqueur. I really really like this one.
Bottle from Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours dark red with no head and a fermented honey aroma. There is a very sweet delicious cherry flavor with finishing chipotle sneak attack. No hint of alcohol.

A nice deep red color. A big barbecue smell very unique. Taste is a perfect cherry sweetness at first. Very natural and pure tasting. A really good heat comes in about halfway through that really fits nicely with the sweet. Really big flavor all around. Good stuff.
Bottle into a glass. Pours deep wine red. Aroma is cherry and smoke. Very fresh. Taste is fresh tart cherry and big, smokey, lightly spicy peppers. Surprisingly smooth and drinkable.

Really cool 375. Pours a somewhat clear ruby color. A huge tart almost woody cherry nose. The flavor is initially wonderful super sweet cherry notes, just damn natural and fantastic. Later the slow heat comes in to a medium burn. The pepper and cherry meld perfectly. Odd really that it works so well. Decadent. Lovely brew. Would pair so well. Sweet honey all through. The heat is there in the back of your throat.

From Douglas

A: Still dark cherry red with good legs.

N: Intense cherry over the honey. Chipotle lends a desert dryness. Reminiscent of lambic without the funk.

T: Chipotle breaking over a perfect sweetness. Some sourness lends itself well to the concoction.

M: Very sticky and drying from the pepper. Lingers.

O: Excellent. Shows deftness of hand.

Bottle from Wine Warehouse. The cork was an absolute bastard to remove. The pourÂ’s deep purple with no head whatsoever. Rich, complex aromas. Meaty cherry compote, the malevolent sting of pepper. Red apple, dark cocoa. The taste is pleasingly sweet and hot. Cherry reduction cut by the finishing heat of the pepper. An earthy, smoky, sweet set of flavors that marry quite well. Full body, syrupy and substantial. Low carbonation. Really well conceived and executed.

Absolutely awesome mead. Nice and sweet, but not over the top or cloying. The cherry adds a nice layer of complexity that in no way takes away from the smokiness from the chipotle peppers. The heat on the finish is perfect.

Bottle. Pours plum red. Aroma like dry red wine with hint of cherry. Initial taste of cherry, then it kicks it up with some heat and chipotle taste. Palate has some heat, but very smooth. Overall an interesting experience.

Poured into a Burley Oak snifter AR: Smells like a red wine. Very fruity and acidic with even a bit of heat tinge on the nostrils. Lots of grape. AP: Lovely, beautiful shade of maroon, like a nice red wine. T: Lots of chipotle and heat/spice in there. P: Very thin with just a bit of syrup-ness with the sweetness of the mead. No carbonation at all but a nice hint of spice that prickles the tongue and throat but recedes quickly. O: Different. This is my first of their semi-normal meads. Quite the sipper.

1 nov 2013, bottle. Red, clear, no bubbles. Nose is cherry and wood. Thin body and mildly fizzy. Sweet cherry syrup up front that immediately fades in to a respectable chipotle heat. Really good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Corked bottle. Deep red pour. Lots of sweet honey, a bit floral, juicy red cherries, finishes smokey peppers, and zing-y spicy heat that can burn your nose. Very sweet and dense. Heavy sipper for an interesting dessert.

Looks like a glass of thin blood. An insane amount of cherry. Like drinking cherry sno cone syrup, and almost as much heat. Cherry and heat. And more cherry. Reminds me of mango magnificom but with cherry instead.

Bottle. Pours a ruby red with no head. Aroma is a mix of sweet/tart cherries, light earthy chile pepper, mild smoky chipotle. Taste is complex, nice sweet cherries, mild tartness, creeping heat and smoke from the chipotle. Sticky mouthfeel that sticks to your palate where the heat shows up again to say hi. Lightly boozy notes mixed with the heat on the. Finish.

Bottle to glass. Pours a clear deep reddish-violet-mahoganey color with no head. Aroma is very sweet, with hints of bing cherry and a very mild chipotle character. Chipotle is much more present in the taste and finish. Taste starts with a sweet cherry, light honey, that quickly fades into a pretty potent chipotle bite, with a lingering spicy burn in the finish. Very complex. Excellent mead, but donÂ’t think it could be a regular.

(IÂ’ve never reviewed a mead before) Pours a really dark ruby red, almost purple. Looks almost just like a glass of red wine. The dark, somewhat tart cherries come through the most in the nose, black pepper, almost reminds me of a fruity pinot noir, you can definitely smell the honey, some red grapes, nice bit of alcohol, and you can certainly pick out the light smokiness from the chipotles. Very nice taste, very sweet though, some strong cherry/dark fruit notes, plenty of alcohol, some light smokiness and a healthy dose of heat. Very tasty. Definitely a sipper desert drink, though. IÂ’ll have to try more meads to expand my palate.
Fantastic cherry pie filling flavor with a little smoky burn on the finish. Great dessert mead.
Deep red pour. Aroma is floral, fruity, spicy. Flavor is sweet and spicy. Light burn in the back of the throat. Really interesting flavors.
Crazy tasting mead, thank you GT2, super rich cherry juice mixed with honey and strong spices that make this a great chipotle mead

375mL from La Bodega. Inky blood red pour with great alcohol legs. Nose is dark cherry pie, rich/buttery pie crust, juicy black cherry. Taste is closest thing to Heart of Darkness IÂ’ve tried, just dialed down a bit. Chipotle is very subtle and adds a balance to the black cherry sweetness. Incredibly juicy, dessert palate. Just incredible all around. Heart of Darkness Jr.

Wow. This is a fantastic surprise. Beautiful reddish clear pour. Great burnt cherry notes with fantastic chipotle heat in the background. Sustained heartburn lingers. Really quite surprised how good this is.
Jewel-like red color and still. Big fruity nose with a hint of pepper heat. Taste of hostess cherry fruit pie followed closely by pepper heat. This is a great balance of hot and sweet.

ThereÂ’s a sticker stamped 2180213.
Appearance: I absolutely love the color of this, itÂ’s incredibly dark garnet with a velvety haze. This looks nice!
Aroma: The aroma is strong and leans sweet, it reminds me a bit of a Pinot Noir from far away. Sweet cherries are apparent with a slight pepper heat, thereÂ’s a touch of alcohol and honey with a light floral presence. This is complex, but not very inviting to me.
Taste: The intro is very sweet cherry with a honey backing that progresses to an unassuming peppery finish that gets to a mild heat, maybe a tad too hot. The finish lingers, prickling my tongue for a bit, and leaves a warming finish down my throat.
Palate: Velvety and nearing thick, no carbonation.
Overall: What an experience! The heat is a bit too much, but at the same time itÂ’s very nice to have a pronounced presence instead of something subtle. This is a great mead, I enjoy it.

Pours ruby red with no carbonation. Aroma is port-like- huge dark fruit (raisin, cherry) with a very minor floral undercurrent and a bit of astringency. Flavor is quite interesting initial cherry wine character with only a very minor honey note, with a big, warm-in-the-throat chipotle spiciness.ends dry and bitter, with a bit of alcohol sting. A wonderful beverage, but would benefit from more honey character. Thanks mikem409.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a head of no head finely sized bubbles that were fully diminished and left behind a uncarbonated opaque purple hued colored body and a oily lacing. The nice aroma was red currant jelly and honey. The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The nice flavor contained notes of vinous and honey. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2013 375ml bottle. Thanks to dmac for sharing! Pours a dark ruby red color with zero head. Aroma of sweet black cherries, apples, smoke, honey, and chipotle peppers. Flavor of sweet black cherries, chipotle peppers, honey, apples, and cinnamon. Pretty tasty with a nice burn on the back end.

375ml corked bottle, beware you need a wine opener for this even though itÂ’s only a mead. Poured a medium to slightly thinner blood red body with hardly any head, but does blood really have head anyway?? Aroma reminds me of bbq sauce, there is an upfront sweetness from the cherry that slowly lingers and turns into a pepper burn from the chipotle, awesome. Body is average with just a slow building heat after the initial sweetness. Flavor is what this brew is all about. An interesting initial burnt cherry sweetness slowly changes to a chipotle bbq sauce that has an interesting mild sweetness from dark fruit that builds with the addition of molasses and burnt brown sugar but then has a distinct burn from the addition of chipotle peppers that adds a unique twist to really make this mead stand out. Exceptional overall.

Bottle - 375mL corked. Pours the color of kids grape juice (purple-maroon) with no head. Aroma is peppery with dark cherry notes, honey, dark berries and soft smoke. Taste is peppery with dark cherries, honey, dark fruit notes, light smoky notes and candy. Body is light-medium with no carbonation and a nice peppery bite on the back end. Sticky in spots as well but the chipotle peppers are nicely warming. Ends with more pepper and peppery heat alongside ripe berries, dark cherries, cherry pie, honey and smoky notes.

Bottle shared at a mead tasting, poured an amberish red color with aromas of earth, spice, light honey, and some peppers. Flavors are the same, light sweetness up front followed by some spicy peppers, and finished nicly.

Courtesy of tectactoe
Bottle: The aroma consists of sweet cherries, honey, apple, and faint smokey chipotle peppers. It pours a transparent orangish-red with virtually no head. It pretty much looks still. The flavor starts with a sweet cherries, honey, and a touch of apple. The finish has light smokey chipotle peppers and cinnamon. The heat flavors arenÂ’t all that strong, but it definitely leaves a burning sensation on the tongue. ItÂ’s medium-ful bodied with a slightly sticky mouthfeel.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2014 Bottle: Blood red crimson with nice clarity, only a few bubbles at the edges. Aroma is lots of chipotle spice, BBQ-like and woodchip-y. Lots of juicy cherries, lighter and not too sweet. Taste is awesome, like barbecue sauce and chipotle covered cherries. Sweet cherries, honey, BBQ chips, light smoke, and a little chipotle kick in the back. Sweet up front with a spicy finish. Good contrast, awesome stuff.

14% bottle with a newer label than pictured. Pours with a clear, still, very deep red to near purple hue with strong legs. Aromas are of smokey, earthy chipotle, rich chocolate, black cherry, plums, Concorde grapes. Medium sweetness. Extremely complex aroma. Flavors show a decent amount of pepper heat and smokiness, followed by a medium sweet body, tangy and lightly vinous, rich cherries. Chocolate. A great combination of flavors, and amazing balance. Well hidden alcohol, still body, excellent acid and tannin balance. A really unique and good mead!
Bottle into a snifter. No head. Ruby red color. Fruit on front, heat in the back of the throat on the finish. Reminded me of Mango Magnifico from Founders.  14% abv though, not the 12.5%

Bottle @ home, shared by Jake. Blood red pour with nice legs and no carbonation. Strong cherry aroma. Spicy, earthy notes in the background. Sweet honey and fruit, pepper, and a light tannic note. Flavor is kid of savory. Smokey chipotle, moderate spice, and some earth. Sweet cherry and honey, a bit of alcohol, grape skins, and a touch of Pinot noir.
Bottle. Deep red mead with no head. Cherry, sweetish aroma. Cherries, chipotle flavour.

375 ml bottle received by my summer secret santa. Thank you jsquire! Pours hazy blood red with a small bubbly head thatÂ’s gone almost before you notice it without leaving any trace. Smell is sweet and fruity with honey, sour cherries, black cherries, lemon zest, hay, chipotle peppers, alcohol, lemon juice and wood. Taste is sweet, tart, spicy and hot with sour cherries, black cherries, smoked peppers, honey, lemon zest, hay and wood. Finish is fruity tart and spicy hot with honey, sour cherries, black cherries, lemon juice, chipotle peppers, hay and wood. God god thatÂ’s alot of hot tasty cherries!

Bottle at Sweet&Sour in SÃ¤tila 20130810. Pours clear amber/purple. Sweet fruity aroma, cherries, spicy, chilli, vanilla, raspberries, cinnamon, floral notes, honey, some caramel. Cherry flavor, lots of chilli without being too much, strawberries, floral, sourish, warming alcohol, sweet yet dry, woody notes. Cherry finish, alcohol, caramel, spicy, cherries, some chipotle. Very nice.
Bottle tnx to Alex. Pours clear lilac mahogany. Aroma is sweet cherries astringent spicy. Flavor is sweet cherries berry fruity peppery very nice hot finish.

Aroma of cherry pie and slight cranberry. Pours ruby red with no carbonation or head. Taste is super sweet with fresh cherry, pie filling and a nice spicy red pepper. Cloying and sweet but the spicy finish is the cure. Delicious.

Pours a deep dark red. Aroma of cherries, slight peppers and oak. Taste is sweet and tart cherries and then smoke and heat from the peppers. The heat hangs on in the back of your throat. Very tasty with a lot going on
Chilled blue bottle at JStax mead birthday tasting poured into a snifter.  Pours translucent red and medium body.  Taste is cherry and finishes with some chipotle.  Surprised I liked this so much.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2013 Bottle at home. Thanks Ramy! Deep ruby red with practically no head. Lots and lots of cherreis, honey and a bit smoke. Taste is sweet and tart with huge amounts of cherries with a spicy aftertaste. Very odd, but pretty good.
Pours a red wine-like color.  Aroma is cherry, adobo, and spice.  Taste is sweet and spicy with a nice little kick.  Medium bodied and slick.  Interesting and good.

Bottle from trade with umich03jm. Pours a clear reddish-megenta color. Aroma is sweet cherry juice and light alcohol. Taste is upfront chile burn and sweet cherries through the whole experience. Finish lingers far longer than I would have expected. Wow, the brewer didnÂ’t mess around with the chiles. Takes a pair to brew with this much heat, but I like it. Really interesting and unique. Need more of this to share with friends.
WOW! this a flavor explosion nice tart cherries dominate with pepper heat at the back end.  The sweetness of the mead compliments wonderfully.  Really glad I tried this one.  Amazing stuff.
Wow! A sample a mead tasting, huge cherry flavors, heat at the end. Smokey, I love this one

Bottle from Hopcat:  Pours a bright, still ruby color...nose is fairly subtle with the cherry juice and honey shining through.  The chipotle is present but is very subdued.  Flavor is a blast of tart cherries up front followed by the smokiness of the chipotle...finishes with the sweetness from the honey and leaves lingering heat after itÂ’s gone.  Unbelievable

Bottle.  Aroma has notes of sour cherries, smoke, peppers and herbs.  Very dark ruby hue.  Flavor is very sweet and lightly sour.  Palate is full bodied and oily.  Overall a wonderful mead with tart cherries and a nice chipotle burn.  No hint of that 12.5% abv.  Loved it.

Bottle shared with paul and brendan. Pours a dark cherry body with no head or lacing. Aroma is full of rich cherries, peppers, honey and light vanilla extract.  Mouthfeel is medium with notes of dark cherry, light cherry pie, chili peppers, honey and spice.

HavenÂ’t tried many meads but this was delicious.  Sweet, cherry juice with a warm pepper sensation that hits the back of your throat. Hard to believe this has the abv that it does.  Complex , yet extremely well balanced sweetness/smoke/ heat
UPDATED: MAY 14, 2013 Cherries galore, chipotle pepper spices warm the back of my throat. Complex and delicious; well refined, complex. By far my favorite B Nektar.

375 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; cherry red and still. Smells and tastes good too; sweet cherry and...well...chipotle. Excellent balance and nice on the palate. Really good stuff!

Pours a reddish brown with no head. Big cherry nose with a smoky pepper note. Nice medium body, notes of honey, cherry and pepper. Pepper spice lingers into in the finish. Quite nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2015 Pours a very dark cherry color with no head and very little lacing.  Aromas are exactly what I expected and its pretty powerful, honey, cherries and peppers with light smoke.  Taste is just awesome.  Honey and cherries hit first, moderate sweetness, which is perfect.  The smokey peppers take over in the finish and give the perfect amount of smokey heat.  The spicy heat lingers for an incredibly long time.  Somehow the honey sweetness lingers along with the spiciness too.

Poured from a bottle. Pours a darker red. Aroma has notes of cherry, peppers, and sweet honey. Taste has just a touch of tingling heat with cherry tartness. Really nice. IÂ’m surprised at how nicely the chipotles come through. I could drink this one for awhile.

Bottle.  Pours a clear garnet and ruby, incredibly red, looks like straight up cherry juice.  The nose is full of cherry, a bit of honey behind it.  ThereÂ’s just the faintest smoky pepper hint hiding in the background, lurking.  Medium bodied, spicy cherry, but no heat. Then a touch of pepper comes through, still no heat really.  Finishes up with a touch of heat and some warmth  with pepper and cherries lingering on the gums.  Wonderful stuff.
deep red-still.  A-tart cherry, honey, smoke.  T-tart cherry, smoke/spice peppers, honey.

Pours an orangish redish gold, nose is big on cherries and chipolte spices. The taste was a bit more on the spice than the cherry, and I think I would have preferred it to be the other way around. Very worth trying espicailly if you like sweet with a big spice kick.

375 mL bottle from Oak Tree Buy Rite. Pours a clear red-brown color. No head, average legs. Intense cherry pie aroma, spicy chipotles and a background of faintly sweet honey. The taste is tart cherries, cherry pie filling, honey and a lingering chipotle spice. Medium bodied, lingering heat. Nice mead, but, it could be a little more mead-like.

Name: Cherry Chipotle
Date: October 07, 2012
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, First Sunday
Appearance: clear dark red, viscous with legs
Aroma: sweet cherry aroma, hint of chili spicyness
Flavor: sweet cherry flavor, the peppers add a touch of heat to balance the sweetness and add depth, lingering cherry and chipotle finish
Aroma: 8/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 8/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 16/20
Rating: 4/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: ***+ /4

Bottle picked up at BinnyÂ’s Marcey. Pours a deep red, translucent with a brownish tinge at the edges. Completely still. Decent legs. Nose is smokey chipotle, cherry fruit rollups. Earthy with some subdued floral aromatics. Medium tartness in nose. Quite clean. Faint nutmeg note as well. On tasting, it is on the sweeter side but balanced overall. Some balsamic vinegar notes on palate. Light heat from peppers. Cherries are very persistent, fruity and pie like. The tartness grows, along with the head. Some smoke eats itÂ’s way through as well. Medium-full bodied. Quite a nice mead but could use a touch less acidity.

Bottle for a pretty penny from SamÂ’s Quik Shop. Pours bright orange-tinted light red. Mostly still. Nose of honey and cherries and a mild rose/hibiscus note. Hint of smoke/pepper. Taste adds more floral notes first, then cherry/honey sweetness, then the pepper flavor, then a distinct kiss of heat at the end. Unique and lovely. Great after-dinner sipper. Wish I could afford more.

Sample at B Nektar Meadery.  Ruby red with no head.  Aroma is sweet and semi-spicy with honey, cherry and mild chili peppers.  Taste is sweet with a nice spicy backer and is just as advertised Â– honey, cherries and spicy peppers.  Decent.

The aroma is spicy with the requisite chipotle and sweet and fruity with cherry and honey. The appearance is ruby red and still. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is typical. Overall a quality mead with a kick at the end.

There is way too much going on this mead to warrant a single rating. on one hand you got tart cherry and give a good pucker flavor with a sweetness that is in the background. then at the end it hits yo hard with the spicy chipote peppers that definitely packs a punch.

Bottle...  This was superb.  Poured a deep ruby red.  Noticeable honey and cherry on the nose.  Thick mouthfeel, tons of sweetness with pepper and smoked notes and heat and a nice black cherry balance.  A complete joy to drink.

Best mead ive ever had. Poured the color of pomegranate juice with no head. Aroma of red wine. Flavor starts out sweet cherries, backed up by smoke from the chipotle and then a very tart finish. Incredibly complex. Delicious paired with chocolates. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at GTMW - Pours deep ruby with no head. Nose is bold, ripe cherry with a touch of savory. Taste is a blend of sweet cherry with a nice pepper burn. Perfectly balanced between the two. Long slow burn through the finish. Smooth and well-carbonated. Sweet, but balanced. Will seek a bottle out.

8/23/12. 375mL bottle from Grassroots. Beautiful ruby pour with small runs. Lightly tart cherry pie on the aroma with sweet honey and barely a touch of smoke/pepper. Sweet flavor with tart cherry pie and a way bigger dose of slightly smokey peppers. The spice lingers after a few sips. Unique and very tasty!

dark red with no head. i am not a fan of peppers in my beers and meads, but iÂ’ll make an exception here. the chipotle is noticeable, but not overdone. sweet with plenty of cherry flavor. slight smoke.

Bottle. Pours dark cherry. Nose/taste of dark cherries, chili pepper, vanilla, honey and light smoke. Finishes with smoked chili pepper heat intertwined with cherry pit. Medium body. Nice, light lingering chili burn.

375 mL bottle.  Pours ruby red and still, like a red wine.  Sugary cherry aroma, honey, alcohol, slight plastic note.  Oh wow.  First sip lives up to the name, matching definite cherry with definite chili pepper.  Sweetness of honey and smoky pepper back it up, with a slightly tart but still sweet finish and a slight chili pepper heat accompanying it.  The chipotle just adds so much depth to this.  Really, really ridiculously tasty.

375mL bottle, courtesy of my Summer Secret Santa. Big thanks! Enjoying this to celebrate AHA Mead day. Pours a moderately deep ruby color with a thin ring of white bubbles encircling the glass. Sweet aroma is dominated by honey and cherries, with some faint pepper on the tail end; I doubt IÂ’d pick the pepper out if I were sampling this blind. Sweetness hits the palate first, cherry moreso than honey. The flavor of the pepper gradually takes over, with cherry cutting the heat. Really interesting how this develops on the palate. Super enjoyable, once again big thanks to my Santa.

(bottle - corked 375 ml) Clear pinkish pour with not much head. Cherries in the aroma and then as it warms you get a blast of honey and chipotle. Flavor reflects the same. Mild cherry and honey sweetness when cold but a wonderfully spicy and smoky chipotle flavor as it warms up. Burns so good.

Bottle split with my bro in law mike. Pours a a cherry ruby red with barely any head and no lace. Aroma of honey, dark cherry, vino, fresh cooked peppers. Taste is cherry, oak, peppers, honey, flowers, and red hot candy. Not overly sweet or cloying, balanced exceptionally well. The chipotle scared me at first but its so subtle and flavorful, the heat barely is detectable. Mostly only in the finish the peppers come out. Finishes perfect for a mead, mostly cherry and honey up front but fades to a peppery cinnamon. Amazing, maybe my favorite from b nektar so far.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2013 Bottle from Bruisin ales - pours a deep, clear ruby red, no head. Aroma is Spicy and cherries. Love the jalapeÃ±o bite mellowed with the cherry sweetness. Overall, very, very nice!

Bottle from Magsinva. Pours a rich ruby red. Some cherry notes on the nose. Definite cherry on the tongue. The coolest thing is the finish. As It goes down you really get the flavor and the heat from the chipotle. Nice!

Wow. It's like a cherry napalm bomb of goodness. Deep purple in color, nice legs. Nose is very cherry. First taste is sweet and cherry, then a little fire ignites in your mouth as the chipotle heats shit up. A fun sipping mead!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Courtesy of my sister, ratebeerÂ’s 15_2_Kuhnhenn. It pours deep clear plum juice with minimal legginess. The aroma offers up sweet cherry juice followed by chili chipotle meat and then moving into some booziness. The taste creates a pleasing rich cherry juice flowing into firm levels of chili meat, a bit of smokiness and then capsicum heat. The heat really begins to hit midway and it lingers for minutes into the after taste. Great chili meat and heat balance creating a pleasing refreshing experience and making me want to drink this all day long.

Purplish-red colour.  The aroma is fruity and with a little red wine character.  The sweet cherry is right up front, and the chipotle seems to pick up steam across the palate.  Around the middle is the best part, before the heat kicks in.  Sweet dessert mead but I like the flavour combo so it works out ok.
Bottle. Red ruby color. Nice sweet aroma, cherry. Medium mouth feel. Sweet start gives way to lasting heat. Interesting.

Bottle shared by dak at nbutler11Â’s bachelor party.  Damn this was tasty!  Cotton candy color without a bubble for a head.  Touch of honey accompanied by bright Michigan cherries, cracked pepper, and chili heat.  Definitely has a slight capsiason burn in the finish.  The smoke from the jalepenos also makes an entrance.  Really delicious!

Nice red pour.  Aroma of sweet/tart cherries, pepper, chili peppers, honey, sweet florals.  Flavor is delicious! Light spice, good sweetness, honey notes are wonderful.  Floral notes are noticeable on the tongue. Really a cool mead.

Pours a dark crimson color, some ok legs. Aroma is as someone else stated cherry lollipops, straight sweet/hot cherry scent, no honey hints. Flavor is wonderful, starts with the sweetness from the honey and the cherries then it give way to some robust smokey tones that start to let in some heat from the peppers, some earthy qualities. This sounded odd, it is odd, but it all works together so amazingly well, loving b nektars products.

Bottle 375ml. blue glass @ [ Edinburgh Danish Invasion Tasting) by cgarvieuk - Edinburgh ].Clear dark red colour with no head. Aroma is moderate honey, sweet chili fruit, moderate to light heavy cherry, light pepper. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light light acidic with a long duration, cherry, honey, pepper, chili burn. Body is medium, texture is watery - syrupy, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20120422]

Tasted this at B. Nektar.  Pours a dark red color.  Aroma is big cherries, a little bit of sweetness and maybe a bit of smokiness.  Flavor is big cherries up front and then right away you can taste the spicy smoky peppers.  I love chipotle peppers and this is pretty tasty.  A decent amount of heat but the honey sweetness probably helps with that overall.  Not a ton of sweetness here, the peppers and cherry definitely are center stage.  Good stuff.

Bottle with OmegaX - thanks friend!
Appearance - Cherry red, clean body
Aroma - Peppers, dirt, lollipop
Taste - Hot, cherries, tart & dry, crisp

OmegaX - you are the man! This beer was f*cking increcible! It smelled straight up like cherry lollipops and peppers with light earthy hints. The taste was like those funky cajun/raisin sucker pops from Mexico. Lots of heat in the body, while the finish is tart and sweet... almost calming the palate for another sip. Wow.

PoppinÂ’ that cherry mead. Body is dark ruby colored and sexy. I got a lot of buttery qualities and some light smokey cherry notes on the nose. Like a fruity, smokey red wine. Taste is rich and intense. A subtle amount of heat hits you as you drink more of this elixir. This one in is rather sweet with some heavy cherry and berry notes with more butter qualities, and some smokey notes. I thoroughly enjoyed this one. B. Nektar did it again.

In bottle. Pours a beautiful ruby colour with an aroma of mulled wine, spiced red cabbage, port wine, chilli, cherries and light cloves. An upfront chilli burn gives way to sweet cherries, braised red cabbage, cloves, alcohol and a little cherry flavoured cough syrup. Fantastic!!

Bottle thanks to cgarvieuk at his Danish Invasion tasting. Absolutely incredible colour, a vivid dark purple maroon. Looks like a very, VERY good Burgundy. Nice pungent nose, tart cherry and a touch of juniper, some chipotle smokiness. Gorgeous tart cherry up-front, slight honey backbone and a big, BIG chipotle chilli burn that shouldnÂ’t work at all, but somehow does. Maybe even a touch of sourness. Very disparate elements but somehow it just almost works. Challenging but tasty.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2015 bottle at The Danish Invasion tasting APR 2012 ... lovely deep red colour ... odd ... light hint of sour .. massive cherry ... juniper ... rich soft sweet cherry ... big spice ... mellow fruits ...  big sweet cherry ... big spice ... wonderfully rich and spicy ... 4.4.

Bottle at home July 2015 ... deep red .. thin  lacing .. soft fruits .. massive cherrry stones ... almost cinamon nose ... soft fruits .. massive cherry .. lightest chipolte ... soft dry cherrry .. its just so rich and divine 4.7

ive totally failed to rerate this 3-4 times

Bottle shared with friends. Dark red pour with no head and minimal legs. Aroma of black cherry, honey and light pepper. Sweet honey and black cherry flavor at first, but the pepper heat comes fast and furious before a tart cherry finish. Could have used a little more subtlety on the pepper flavor, but not bad.

pours a dark still red. smells of chillies and cherry with some sweetness and yeast esters. lots of cherry with a a decent chillie pepper flavor and a good deal of heat. mouthfeel is full and rich. sweet with a moderate kick of heat.

Bottle - Thanks Paul and Zack - pours slightly dark red, nice cherry aroma, tastes of cherries, honey, and peppers balanced nicely and nothing overpowering, finally some nice heat that lasts for a couple of seconds in the throat. Great job, B. Nektar!!!

2oz sample at bad apple, Chicago. Triple nice... Pours a shade darker than garnet red, more so than I expected, dark but not totally opaque... Dark cherry nose enhanced with a bit of pepper on the nose with the aforementioned taking centerstage. Nice without the pepper being dominant like the wild blossom... Flavors have more of a smoked pepper and cherry component moreso than hney although the latter develops
moreso as it lingers on the palate. The heat intensity increases as more sips are consumed. Nice.

Bright blood red, clear... Aroma is light mostly chipotle, hot, finishes with cherries, candyish, too much pepper... Tastes very sweet to tart, candy cherries but then a bombardment of peppers on the finish, really enjoy the balance of sweet vs spicy, feel is good but the flavored are muddled... Interesting, unique but only a rec for pepper lovers

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at Cajun Cafe fest.  Pours a nice shade of red.  Aromas of tart earthy cherry skins and mild peppers.  Flavors are sweet honey and cherry juice up front.  A bit of tart cherry in the middle.  There is a earthy burn in the finish that lasts a few moments.  Tasty!

Sampled at the Cajun Cafe 2011 Fall Beer Fest.  Pours a deep red with nose of deep earthy and some tart cherries along with some earthy peppers that feel like they could help or hurt this mead.  Flavor is similar- the honey is light or if itÂ’s not, then it blends well with the cherries.  The cherries come out earthy and a bit tart with some honey and booze followed by the earthy peppers that burn for just a bit then fade off.  Wonderful blend here with a bit of booze.
